channel.title: Microorganisms on AgriSoil
channel.description: Recent content in Microorganisms on AgriSoil

item.title: The Bugs and Beasts of the Soil: How They Contribute to a Healthy Ecosystem
item.description: Introduction Soil biodiversity is the variety of living organisms found in the soil and their interactions with each other and their environment. This includes all forms of life, from the smallest microorganisms to invertebrates and vertebrates. Soil supports a wide variety of living organisms and plays a critical role in the health of our planet. It provides essential nutrients, water, and air for plants, animals, and other organisms. It also helps regulate the climate, prevents erosion, and stores carbon.
